data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
In one instruction: Once you are backward, you take 10 steps backward. Thus, the answer is no.

Turn right, there is a line in the middle. The answer: Yes.

If you take 6 steps and turn around you get to the starting point. If you turn around and take 4 steps you get to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

It would take 7 steps and 1 step to return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

Turning from left to right takes 9 steps. When you turn from left to right again you take 3 steps and turn left. Whenever you turn from left to right you take 5 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you turn around back at the beginning position then you have to take 8 more steps to get back out. If you turn around and then turn back then you still have to take 8 more steps to get back out. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person starts out facing forward, moves in that direction taking one step but ends up facing back towards where they started. The first position the person had to move in was facing left and moving 4 steps. The second position the person had to move in was facing right and moving 1 step more. Remember that the first position the person had to move in was facing right and moving 4 steps. The third location the person had to move in was facing left and moving 4 steps the second position the person had to move and 6 steps the third position the person had to move is 6 steps in front of them and 6 steps behind them. This means you cannot return back to the starting position. So, the answer is No.

If you turn around, you’re taking 2 steps, so you take 2 steps back to the beginning. Taking one step back instead of the previous one is not in the instructions. So, the answer is no.

Taking 1 step backward is the same thing as taking 3 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

A backward step is backwards no matter how many steps you take it is. If you take 5 steps left you are going to reverse your direction of movement. If you take 6 steps back you will take 6 steps backward. So, the answer is no.

Place your right foot ad half your weight behind your left foot. Take 3 steps, keep your forefinger and shift your weight slightly left until you are standing upright. Repeat steps 1-4 until you are standing upright. Immediately take 1 step left. Take 3 steps, take your right foot and the same weight and shift your left foot until you are standing upright. Repeat steps 1-4 until you are standing upright, take 4 steps right.

Take 3 steps to the side. Move up 5 steps. Move down 2 steps. Turn left 10 steps. Take 5 steps up. Move 1 step. Turn right 10 steps. Move left 10 steps. Move right 4 steps. Turn left 8 steps. Go 2 steps. Turn right 10 steps. Move left 3 steps. Turn right 2 steps. Go 2 steps. Turn left 2 steps. Move left 2 steps. Turn left 2 steps. Go 2 steps. Turn right 10 steps. Move up 1 step. Flip the box clockwise and go 2 steps up. Continue like this until you’re facing a complete circle.
